docs.lead_paragraph: Monologue | Aired Thursday night on NBC: Here's the latest from the Pentagon. The generals are worried that the White House is spreading itself thin by trying to fight a war on two fronts, with Afghanistan and Fox News.
docs.abstract: Monologue | Aired Thursday night on "The Jay Leno Show": Here's the latest from the Pentagon. The generals are worried that the White House is spreading itself thin by trying to fight a war on two fronts, with Afghanistan and Fox News.

docs.lead_paragraph: Americans without health insurance are less likely to know if they have diabetes or high cholesterol than those with coverage, and they're less likely to keep their high blood pressure under control than the insured, a new study reports.
docs.abstract: A study finds that the uninsured are less likely than the insured to manage such chronic conditions as hypertension and high cholesterol.
docs.snippet: A study finds that the uninsured are less likely than the insured to manage such chronic conditions as hypertension and high cholesterol.

docs.lead_paragraph: Anybody watching the Yankee-Angels series understands why home field advantage offers such an important edge. He who bats last often laughs last.

headline.main: Seeking the Home-Field Advantage on the Public Option

docs.abstract: In the Senate, supporters of the public option want it in the bill at the outset -- daring opponents to strip it out. Opponents want just the opposite, forcing proponents to find the votes to add it as an amendment.
docs.snippet: In the Senate, supporters of the public option want it in the bill at the outset -- daring opponents to strip it out. Opponents want just the opposite, forcing proponents to find the votes to add it as an amendment.

docs.lead_paragraph: The roller coaster ride that is the fate of the public option continues.

headline.main: The Early Word: The Public Option Rises

docs.abstract: The Senate majority leader considers including the public insurance option into health care legislation.
docs.snippet: The Senate majority leader considers including the public insurance option into health care legislation.

docs.lead_paragraph: Uwe E. Reinhardt is an economics professor at Princeton.

headline.main: The Case for Mandating Health Insurance

docs.abstract: An economist explains why requiring individuals to purchase health insurance is a necessary part of expanding Americans' access to care.
docs.snippet: An economist explains why requiring individuals to purchase health insurance is a necessary part of expanding Americans' access to care.

docs.lead_paragraph: The New York Times Company reported a $35.6 million loss for the third quarter on falling advertising revenue, but deep cost-cutting and newspaper price increases helped beat projections.

headline.print_headline: Times Co. Reports Loss But Beats Estimates
